title: Um, Did CNN Mean To Hire This Conservative?
text:
CNN announced on Sunday that former Rep. Sean Duffy has joined the network as a policy analyst. The soon-to-be father of nine left Congress on September 23rd to spend more time with his family.

In Congress, Duffy was a strong defender of the President and his policies. It will be interesting to see how the network handles having an articulate, conservative spokesperson on its airways. My guess? Not well.

Meanwhile, Project Veritas continues to release undercover videos exposing the liberal bias of CNN's reporting and the anti-Trump agenda of the network's president, Jeff Zucker.

BREAKING: Field Production Supervisor @CNN Gerald Sisnette: “The Only Way This Will Go Away is When He (Trump) Dies. Hopefully Soon.”#ExposeCNN pic.twitter.com/HxzfP6FOTc — James O'Keefe (@JamesOKeefeIII) October 17, 2019

"There's a lot of people who are out here trying to like just do what they think is the best of journalistic integrity...Then you get on the 9AM call and big boss Jeff Zucker f**king tells you what to do" - CNN Media Coordinator#ExposeCNN



Comment? @CNN pic.twitter.com/bSHQW53qWu — James O'Keefe (@JamesOKeefeIII) October 19, 2019

Duffy announced in late August that he would be resigning his congressional seat to spend more time with his family. In a Facebook post back in August, the five-term representative announced he would be stepping down to spend more time with his family. Duffy, already the father of eight children, revealed that baby number nine, due in late October, will need more of the former congressman's "love, time, and attention due to complications, including a heart condition."

"On September 23, I will step down and allow others to step forward to begin laying out their own vision and plans for leading this beautiful district and the most honest, hard-working, family-oriented, patriotic, and God-fearing constituents in America," Duffy stated on Facebook.

Not that many people watch CNN, but maybe Sean Duffy can straighten the record for the few viewers still watching.
description: CNN announced on Sunday that former Rep. Sean Duffy has joined the network as a policy analyst..10/20/2019 19:18:22PM EST.
